review_title: Hard working Passionate Leadership and Staff
pros: Fulfilling working with people going through some of the toughest challenges in their lives. Passionate and knowledgeable leadership team(s) with years of education and experience. Never a dull moment. Flexible. Good Benefits. Promote from within. Ability to advance.
cons: Challenging field to work in. It is a non-profit so the pay is not as good as for profit industry. If you do not have a passion for the mental health and substance use disorder field, this job is not for you.

job_title: Director of Accounting in Pueblo, CO
pros: Great place to work. I love the community impact
cons: Quite a few different programs to oversee and maintain.
Insane work environment. Supervisors are not the best of trainers and will pile on the maximum workload that they can. Terrible bosses.

review_title: Supportive Company Making a Positive Impact In SE Colorado
pros: I have worked at CTP for 5 years and it has been a blessing. I cannot foresee myself leaving this great organization. The staff and management are supportive to create a postive workplace culture and encourage growth and improvement for future advancement. The staff understand and appreciate their critical role of bettering the community by combatting substance abuse.
cons: Due to being nonprofit, compensation and benefits lack slightly

pros: The staff is friendly and location is perfect
cons: High turn over with medical assistants

review_title: Do you like your job to be fair?
pros: Great to expand your knowledge of the rehabilitation business. Earn your CAC while working there.  Training is outstanding for understanding the job.
cons: Poor pay, poor managment, mistreatment of employees, outdated supplies, Favoritism, management attitudes, poor upkeep of office, theft, and false promises.

job_title: Detox Case Manager in Pueblo, CO
pros: There were none to write home about
cons: female workers were more apt to yell at you for no reason while the guts were very chill in communicating with you. The females were arrested and didn’t care while the males showed empathy and joked around making the detox experience a little more relaxing.

pros: The people you work with are great!
